title: Honey on White Bagel Halves
description: Simple, fast-digesting carbs for 15–30 minutes before a match. Keeps stomach light while providing quick glucose.

ingredients.notes: Low fiber for fast gastric emptying: the rate food exits the stomach

instructions: Split the white bagel into halves.
Drizzle honey evenly over the cut sides.
Eat 30 minutes before stepping on the mat.
wrestling_specific_benefits: Simple sugars provide immediate energy without heaviness
Very low fiber reduces risk of GI distress during warm-up

title: Graham Crackers with Honey
description: Portable, low-fiber snack tailored for rapid energy 15–30 minutes pre-match.
instructions: Lay graham crackers flat.
Drizzle honey over the surface.
Finish 30 minutes before your match.
wrestling_specific_benefits: Fast-digesting carbs top off glycogen quickly
Minimal fat and fiber to avoid stomach discomfort

title: Banana and Salted Crackers Combo
description: Gentle pre-match fuel combining simple carbs and a pinch of sodium to support hydration.

ingredients.notes: Small portion to keep stomach light

instructions: Peel banana and break into bite-size pieces.
Eat banana alongside salted crackers for a small sodium boost.
Finish 30 minutes before match.
wrestling_specific_benefits: Simple carbs provide quick energy for explosive efforts
Sodium supports fluid retention for better hydration during rounds

title: Rice Cakes with Jelly
description: Ultra-light pre-match carbs that digest quickly and won't sit heavy.

ingredients.notes: Thin spread to avoid excess sugar volume

instructions: Spread a thin layer of jelly on each rice cake.
Eat 30 minutes before match for quick energy.
wrestling_specific_benefits: Low residue keeps stomach calm during warm-up
Quick glucose availability supports short, intense bouts

title: Sports Drink + Bagel Quarter
description: Balanced pre-match plan: small portion of solid carbs plus electrolytes for rapid absorption.

ingredients.notes: Small solid carb to avoid heaviness

instructions: Sip sports drink as you eat the bagel quarter.
Finish 30 minutes before match.
wrestling_specific_benefits: Electrolytes aid hydration and muscle function
Small carb portion tops off glycogen without GI upset

title: Banana Honey Tortilla Roll-Up
description: White flour tortilla wrapped around banana and honey for quick, low-fiber energy.
instructions: Lay tortilla flat and drizzle honey down the center.
Place banana on top and roll tightly.
Eat 30 minutes before match.
wrestling_specific_benefits: Low-fiber, low-fat for minimal stomach load
Portable format suits fast tournament transitions

title: Applesauce Pouch + Graham Crackers
description: Kid-friendly, gentle carbs that digest quickly and travel well.
instructions: Open pouch and sip slowly.
Eat graham crackers alongside for extra carbs.
Finish 30 minutes before match.
wrestling_specific_benefits: Very easy on the stomach for nervous competitors
Portable and shelf-stable for long tournament days

title: Blueberry Green Tea Recovery Sipper
description: Make-ahead recovery drink combining frozen blueberries, green tea, and electrolytes. The frozen fruit naturally releases nutrients and flavor as it thaws, creating a delicious antioxidant-rich drink that's perfect for post-practice recovery.

ingredients.notes: Frozen fruit releases nutrients as it thaws
Brings out anthocyanin colors and adds tartness
Choose one with potassium and sodium

instructions: Boil 2 liters of water and steep 3–4 green tea bags for 5 minutes.
Remove tea bags and pour hot tea over frozen blueberries in a large pitcher with filter spout.
Add lemon juice, sweetener, and electrolyte mix. Stir well.
Let cool to room temperature, then refrigerate.
Tastes even better the next day as flavors develop. Strain through filter spout when serving.
wrestling_specific_benefits: Anthocyanins from blueberries support cognitive focus during competition
Natural electrolytes plus added mix support hydration and recovery
Antioxidants help reduce inflammation from intense training
Make-ahead convenience perfect for busy wrestling families
storage: Refrigerate up to 4–5 days. Flavor improves over time.

title: Strawberry Hibiscus Recovery Drink
description: Refreshing make-ahead recovery drink with frozen strawberries and tart hibiscus tea. High in vitamin C and natural antioxidants for post-practice recovery.

ingredients.notes: Frozen fruit releases nutrients as it thaws
Choose one with potassium and sodium

instructions: Boil 2 liters of water and steep 3–4 hibiscus tea bags for 5 minutes.
Remove tea bags and pour hot tea over frozen strawberries in a large pitcher with filter spout.
Add lemon juice, sweetener, and electrolyte mix. Stir well.
Let cool to room temperature, then refrigerate.
Tastes even better the next day as flavors develop. Strain through filter spout when serving.
wrestling_specific_benefits: High vitamin C content supports immune system during training stress
Natural electrolytes plus added mix support hydration and recovery
Caffeine-free option perfect for evening practices
Tart flavor helps combat post-practice nausea
storage: Refrigerate up to 4–5 days. Flavor improves over time.

title: Peach White Tea Recovery Blend
description: Gentle make-ahead recovery drink with frozen peaches and delicate white tea. Light caffeine content and natural sweetness make it perfect for post-practice recovery.

ingredients.notes: Frozen fruit releases nutrients as it thaws
Choose one with potassium and sodium

instructions: Boil 2 liters of water and steep 3–4 white tea bags for 5 minutes.
Remove tea bags and pour hot tea over frozen peaches in a large pitcher with filter spout.
Add lemon juice, sweetener, and electrolyte mix. Stir well.
Let cool to room temperature, then refrigerate.
Tastes even better the next day as flavors develop. Strain through filter spout when serving.
wrestling_specific_benefits: Light caffeine provides gentle energy boost without jitters
Natural electrolytes plus added mix support hydration and recovery
Sweet, smooth flavor appeals to younger wrestlers
Antioxidants help reduce inflammation from training
storage: Refrigerate up to 4–5 days. Flavor improves over time.

title: Mixed Berry Rooibos Recovery Blend
description: Caffeine-free make-ahead recovery drink with frozen mixed berries and naturally sweet rooibos tea. Perfect for evening practices or caffeine-sensitive wrestlers.

ingredients.notes: Choose mix with blueberries for anthocyanins
Brings out berry colors and adds tartness
Choose one with potassium and sodium

instructions: Boil 2 liters of water and steep 3–4 rooibos tea bags for 5 minutes.
Remove tea bags and pour hot tea over frozen mixed berries in a large pitcher with filter spout.
Add lemon juice, sweetener, and electrolyte mix. Stir well.
Let cool to room temperature, then refrigerate.
Tastes even better the next day as flavors develop. Strain through filter spout when serving.
wrestling_specific_benefits: Anthocyanins from dark berries support cognitive focus during competition
Caffeine-free formula won't interfere with sleep after evening practices
Natural electrolytes plus added mix support hydration and recovery
Antioxidant blend helps reduce inflammation from intense training
storage: Refrigerate up to 4–5 days. Flavor improves over time.

title: Blackberry Oolong Recovery Elixir
description: Sophisticated make-ahead recovery drink combining frozen blackberries with complex oolong tea. Rich in anthocyanins for cognitive support and moderate caffeine for focus.

ingredients.notes: High in anthocyanins for cognitive benefits
Brings out anthocyanin colors and balances flavors
Choose one with potassium and sodium

instructions: Boil 2 liters of water and steep 3–4 oolong tea bags for 5 minutes.
Remove tea bags and pour hot tea over frozen blackberries in a large pitcher with filter spout.
Add lemon juice, sweetener, and electrolyte mix. Stir well.
Let cool to room temperature, then refrigerate.
Tastes even better the next day as flavors develop. Strain through filter spout when serving.
wrestling_specific_benefits: High anthocyanin content supports cognitive focus and memory during competition
Moderate caffeine provides sustained energy without crash
Natural electrolytes plus added mix support hydration and recovery
Complex antioxidant profile helps reduce inflammation from intense training
storage: Refrigerate up to 4–5 days. Flavor improves over time.

title: Thermos Chicken Rice Bowl
description: Complete between-match meal packed warm in a thermos: lean protein, digestible carbs, and soft vegetables.
instructions: Layer warm rice, chicken, and vegetables in a thermos.
Drizzle with light teriyaki and sprinkle sesame seeds if using.
Seal immediately and eat 1–2 hours before next match.
wrestling_specific_benefits: 25–30g protein aids muscle repair between matches
Warm, soft foods reduce GI stress while providing sustained energy
storage: Keep hot in thermos up to 4–5 hours; refrigerate leftovers within 2 hours; reheat to 165°F.

title: Turkey Power Sandwich Kit
description: Cooler-friendly sandwich kit with lean protein, digestible carbs, and fruit for sustained energy.
instructions: Assemble turkey sandwich with mustard.
Pack fruit and string cheese on the side.
Eat 1–2 hours before the next match.
wrestling_specific_benefits: 25g+ protein supports recovery between bouts
Low-fiber carbs prevent stomach heaviness
storage: Keep sandwich refrigerated in cooler; consume within 24 hours.

title: Protein Shake + Bagel Combo
description: Shelf-stable protein shake paired with a white bagel for complete between-match fueling.
instructions: Sip protein shake while eating the bagel.
Finish 60–90 minutes before the next match if possible.
wrestling_specific_benefits: Protein supports muscle repair and satiety
White bagel provides sustained, easily digestible carbs
storage: Keep shake cold per label; eat bagel same day.

title: Egg and Sweet Potato Bowl
description: Gentle, complete meal with hard-boiled eggs and soft cooked sweet potato cubes plus vegetables.
instructions: Combine eggs, sweet potato, and vegetables in a bowl or container.
Season lightly with salt if desired.
Eat 1–2 hours before the next match.
wrestling_specific_benefits: 20g protein supports recovery
Soft textures reduce GI stress while providing sustained energy

title: Deli Turkey Wrap + Fruit
description: Portable wrap with lean protein and easy-to-digest fruit for a balanced between-match meal.
instructions: Spread mustard on tortilla, add turkey and lettuce.
Roll tightly and slice in half.
Eat with fruit 1–2 hours before the next match.
wrestling_specific_benefits: 25g protein supports muscle recovery
Moderate fiber keeps digestion comfortable
storage: Keep refrigerated in cooler; eat within 24 hours.

title: Ground Turkey Rice Bowl (Make-Ahead)
description: Family-friendly batch meal: seasoned lean ground turkey over white rice with soft vegetables, packed for tournaments.

ingredients.notes: Optional for flavor, keeps portion light

instructions: Layer rice, ground turkey, and vegetables in a meal container.
Drizzle soy sauce and a touch of olive oil if using.
Eat 1–2 hours before the next match.
wrestling_specific_benefits: 30g protein aids repair without heavy sauces
Digestible carbs refuel glycogen for late-day matches

title: Hummus Snack Box with Eggs
description: Cooler-friendly snack box combining protein, carbs, and soft vegetables for sustained energy.
instructions: Pack hummus, eggs, crackers, and vegetables in a snack box.
Eat 1–2 hours before the next match.
wrestling_specific_benefits: Protein and carbs provide balanced energy between bouts
Simple, portable components reduce prep stress on tournament day
storage: Keep refrigerated in cooler; consume within 24 hours.
